link.title: School Closure Technology Support
link.script:

SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 */ var b=function(){this.c=""};b.prototype.toString=function(){return"SafeScript{"+this.c+"}"};b.prototype.a=function(a){this.c=a};(new b).a("");var c=function(){this.g=""};c.prototype.toString=function(){return"SafeStyle{"+this.g+"}"};c.prototype.a=function(a){this.g=a};(new c).a("");var d=function(){this.f=""};d.prototype.toString=function(){return"SafeStyleSheet{"+this.f+"}"};d.prototype.a=function(a){this.f=a};(new d).a("");var e=function(){this.b=""};e.prototype.toString=function(){return"SafeHtml{"+this.b+"}"};e.prototype.a=function(a){this.b=a};(new e).a("");(new e).a("");(new e).a("
");}).call(this);

h3.div: The South Central Regional Information Center (SCRIC), in partnership with BT BOCES, DCMO BOCES and ONC BOCES, is now offering technology support for students and families during school district closures.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: Technology support is primarily provided via phone by our service desk analysts.

When calling for support, our service desk analysts will greet you, share their name, and ask a few security questions. We will provide our best effort to address issues you may be experiencing, however, we wanted to share there may be issues we are not able to address (ex: Internet or power outages).
Our service desk analysts are looking forward to assisting you! They can be reached at 607-766-3800.

p.em: Please note: If your question is specific to the instructional content of online material set up for your class, please reach out directly to your teacher and/or school personnel.*

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Technology support is provided for the students and families in the districts listed below. For district specific resources, please click the school district name.

div.small: Disclaimer: For questions about the use of online applications/ed tech tools and students' personally identifiable information, please reach out to your school district.
